com.yantra.api.ycd

Interface managePriceMatch

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCDApi, YIFApi

    public interface managePriceMatch

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document managePriceMatch(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The managePriceMatch API takes Item, ItemPrice and CompetitorName, ExpirationDate, RegionCity, RegionState, ShippingCharges, Operation (Create,Modify,Manage,Delete) and can insert, update or delete a Price Match record in the YFS_PRICE_MATCH Table.For Update and Delete, PriceMatchKey is a mandatory parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • managePriceMatch

        org.w3c.dom.Document managePriceMatch(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException
        The managePriceMatch API takes Item, ItemPrice and CompetitorName, ExpirationDate, RegionCity, RegionState, ShippingCharges, Operation (Create,Modify,Manage,Delete) and can insert, update or delete a Price Match record in the YFS_PRICE_MATCH Table.For Update and Delete, PriceMatchKey is a mandatory parameter. While Modifying a record, ItemID or Competitor is not allowed as blank. These parameters should not get passed if they are not to be changed. If ItemID or Competitor is passed, they should not be blank. When PriceMatchKey is not passed and Operation is Blank Operation is Defaulted to Create. In case PriceMatchkey is passed and operation is blank Operation is Defaulted to Modify.

        EnterpriseCode is validated while creating or modifying a price match record. When the itemID or competitor is passed in the input it will be validated in the system to be valid and return errors if the values passed are not valid.

        When an existing price's status is changed to "APPROVED" the API will update all the orders linked to this price match.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD
        * *

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.pca.ycd.japi.ue.YCDManagePriceMatchUE
            This user exit will be called to provide a template over the output of the API. The error code YCD00040 is thrown if an exception occurs during the invocation of this user exit.

          Events Raised:

          ON_STATUS_CHANGE
          This event is raised on successful changing of the status on the price match record. Transaction ID: YCD_PRC_MTH_STS_CHANGE Data published: YCD_MANAGE_PRC_MTCH.ON_STATUS_CHANGE.xml Template Support: Yes Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

          Audits: None

          Pre-conditions: None

          Post-conditions: None

          Output Template Support: Yes

          Additional Information
          This UserExit is not implemented

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains attributes of the Price match Record to be inserted updated or deleted and the operation which is to be performed. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the details of the Price Match record which has been operated.In case of Delete Operation It returns a Blank documentoutput files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
